document_data.name: ''Coin of Jisan the Bountiful''
document_data.mainbody: The '''''Coin of Jisan the Bountiful''''' was an [[artifact]] that bestowed great wealth and long life upon its owner. It took the shape of a simple gold coin, and was connected with the [[Zakhara]]n [[Zakharan pantheon|deity]] [[Jisan]].
document_data.Description: The ''Coin of Jisan'' was a small gold coin adorned on both sides by a veiled female face—the symbol of Jisan,
document_data.Powers:
The owner of the ''Coin of Jisan'' grew generally more skillful, especially in regards to mercantile affairs. Their business never suffered any ill fortune, their crops were bountiful, and their livestock exclusively gave birth to twins. In addition, they gained the ability to cast certain spells: ''[[suggestion]]'', ''[[plant growth]]'', and—occasionally—''[[weather control]]''.

The power of the ''Coin'' was intended to be shared—greedy usage resulted in a [[curse]] being placed on its owner. This curse increased its victims hunger proportionally to their greed: a person who had abused the ''Coin of Jisan'' to amass great personal wealth and power would find themselves having to devour extreme quantities of food, [[tea]], and [[kaeth|coffee]]. The only way to be rid of the curse was to give the ''Coin'' to a stranger.
document_data.History:
As old as the goddess for whom it was named, the ''Coin of Jisan'' was coveted and feared by several powerful groups. Several [[Grand Caliph|caliphs]] found themselves the subject of revolts led by popular ''Coin'' owners. Wiser caliphs chose to ally with bearers of the ''Coin'' instead, by marrying their daughters away.

The ''Coin of Jisan'' was especially coveted by the [[dao]] of Zakhara, who were eager to steal its power for themselves. It was also an object of interest to the [[holy slayer]]s of the [[Gilded Palm]].

Despite the interest of these powerful entities, the ''Coin'' was carried by worshipers of Jisan for most of its history, although it was never known to have had the same owner for more than seven years at a time.
document_data.Reputation: The ''Coin of Jisan'' was said to be given to its owners by Jisan, or by [[Zakharan pantheon#Fate|Fate]] itself. It was well known for bestowing prosperity, wisdom, and fertility on its bearers.
